Review_body: This was one of the best movies ever made. I loved the spiders, Moaning Myrtle, and the special effects. I also loved how most of the actors seemed to slip right into their roles. The only complaint I have is that Daniel Radcliffe had slow reaction time with some of the special effects, but that just seemed to add humor to the movie.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: weakest of the books, it's also a quite boring movie (spoilers)
Review_body:
I went to the theater in Rome with fair expectations last night, and I was quickly upset. I didn't really love the first movie, even if I 've enjoyed some nice ideas and visual effects... overall it was a fair children movie, with a linear story behind, not that impressive, but still entertaining for some.Alas, this new HP movie really bored me down... 2 1/2 hours of the same long, repetitive and boring sequences, with absolutely nothing new compared to HP/SS.On the positive side, I can savekenneth Branagh's character (he's a hell of an actor, and he proves it, even if maybe Hugh grant was better for the part)-the improved quidditch CGI (much better than the first one).-Hermione Granger: she'll be a good actress, my bet is...Jason Isaacs as Lucius Malfoy: very good indeed, as usual when he plays the villain...
On the negative side:1) the other children act terribly . Daniel Ratcliff and Rupert Grint are simply not as good as they should be.2) the story lacks of interest and is reeeeally slow (that's a problem of the book anyway, which is the worst of all four)3) Chris Columbus! He's not a great director, and proves it shockingly whit this film. Not only he's not on the same level of Jackson(director of the LOTR trilogy, which has been compared - wrongly- to the HP movie effort these days, who proved to be a great artist in his portrait of the wonderful Tolkien's vision), he's just a barely fair artisan, nothing more. His decision to adhere strictly to the book storyline is one of the causes to the film mediocrity.4) CGI (apart from quidditch) is on average (especially the Phoenix and the spiders).5) The other actors ,great names including harris (recently deceased) and Maggie Smith, simply aren't given the chance to act as they know, and all seem to ask "why am I acting in here?"...6) the strongest points of the books (the school scenes, the lessons, the dream of all kids to be part of a big, magnificent magic school of old) are all gone and lost, sacrificed on the altar of the "plot crusade" which is so important to Columbus... He's no Peter Jackson, who also adapted a very difficult book to the screen - Tolkien's lotr - but with much better results... this is why this film is so mediocre and will be surely forgotten in the next years.** on *****
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: It was great to see a film where the actors mature with the characters. There has been alot of talk about the actors not continuing with the 4th film but why shouldn't they? As every year they film the movie they are one year older like, just like the students at hogwarts. In America teens are played by actors up to the age of 30. It added to the character of film for talented actors to take great roles, there was a great performance by kenneth Branagh which didn't upstage the young actors all this combined to give a more mature and funnier film than the first one. Bring on the 3rd...............
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: Beautiful effects and a great plot add up to make a wonderful movie
Review_body: Possible spoilers."Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets," the second movie out of a possible seven absolutely delighted the audience. I've only been to a few movies that earned applause at the end, and this was one of them.After being sorely disappointed in the first Harry Potter movie, the second, "Chamber of Secrets," was a wonderful surprise. First of all, the graphics and special effects were great. Hogwarts Castle no longer looked like an obvious computer generated image and the Quidditch Match was very believable. Add the dozens of other effects, and "Chamber of Secrets" really came to life.Unfortunately, the first movie sorely lacked in acting talent in the students, with the exception of Hermione. Although her character is much more of a prat than a caring friend in the movies, Emma Watson does a wonderful job with it. Grint greatly improved from the "Sorcerer's Stone," and absolutely lighted up the screen in his few moments, especially the Aragog scene. The only problem here was the small amount of time we really got to see him in the movie. Radcliffe also improved A LOT from the first movie, in which he seemed more like a wooden board. Harry had emotion in this movie, which made an obvious change. Kenneth Branagh as Professor Lockhart was perfect. I can't even find anything wrong here.Dobby seems to be taking a lot of undeserved bashing. I don't know how people expected him to appear, but he was exactly what I imagined a house-elf to look like. "Annoying?" Yes, he is quote annoying. He is SUPPOSED to be annoying. It is how Rowling meant for him to be. But looking beyond that, you really have to love him. Everyone in the theater I was in laughed at his antics. He is a very important part of the story, and brings more mystery into it. What it would be without him, I can't even imagine.One thing I was upset about was the basilisk. The snake wasn't supposed to physically look like a monster; its terror was in its size and power. The basilisk in the movie looked like a relation of Godzilla.The second most common complaint is how closely if follows the book. Hmm, well, now that I think about it, the movie is supposed to follow the book. Could that possibly have anything to do with it? If any of the major events were changed it wouldn't be predictable, but it wouldn't be how Rowling meant it to be. As a big fan of Harry Potter, I would be outraged if the movie DIDN'T follow the book. The movie is just meant to give the reader a clearer view of characters, which it successfully does. And it was far from unexciting. As a high school student, I can say that I not only laughed during the movie, but I also screamed (really) and jumped many times. The Aragog scene was absolutely terrifying, as were many scenes in the chamber.When you look at negative reviews, they are obviously biased- most say it straight out. I admit it is no "Lord of the Rings," but "Harry Potter" has its own wonderful aspects. The two shouldn't even be compared as they are meant for different audiences.Overall, even though I wasn't expecting very much, I was pleasantly surprised. I can't wait to go see it again.4 1/2 stars out of 5. Wonderful plot, special effects, music, and improved acting.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: I loved it! As much as I love the first one, i thought this one was better! It follows the book really well. The only thing that I found they excluded was the Death Day Party. I was really glad they stayed true to the book and I was really happy with how the movie turned out. I think it lived up to everything it was said to be. IT WAS TOTALLY AWESOME and I would recommend it to anyone...Harry Potter fan or not. <8-)
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: I love it I think it's even better than the first! The acting is great and the action everything seems so real. So if you're considering whether to see it or not I think you should see it!!! :)My fav character has to be Ron he's the funniest!!!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: Without Daniel Radcliffe, reach for the stars!
Review_body: (probable spoilers ahead, so be warned)I have said it once, and I'll say it a million times to convince people: Daniel Radcliffe is the worst thing that happened to Harry Potter.He's bland, and unexpressive, and gives off the impression of being painfully stupid. During his little diary-writing session, WHY OH WHY did he have to speak it as he wrote it? The whole scene was so tedious and repetitive that I very nearly started snoring. UghOf course, he wasn't helped by terrible, jerky scripting (who REALLY talks like that?) and clumsy directing, but as the leading character I would have expected something more than 'I think we found the train' said in a monotone.His supporting actors are brilliant, almost without exception. Rupert Grint is precisely how I imagined Ron, and Emma Watson was equally convincing as Hermione. Although neither of them seemed to feature hugely in the film. The two of them have improved notably, although some of my friends are getting fed up with Rupert Grint's gormless expression. I also thought Tom Felton's performance as Draco was great, although his voice really did scare me at first!If you look even further back into the maze that is Hogwarts, you will encounter the fantastic actors that are the professors. Maggie Smith is particularly impressive, a perfect MacGonagall. And Alan Rickman ... well, maybe I'm biased, but I love him a lot. And I think his Snape is wonderful, albeit a little concerned-looking. Although he was FAT!!!! Noooo ... Richard Harris was a excellent Dumbledore, if a little calculating, and the list goes on ... I was particularly impressed with the narcissicistic Kenneth Branagh as Lockhart - I can't imagine a more perfect portrayal! What I do want to know, though, is why all these incredible actors are demeaning themselves in a Harry Potter film when they could simply get together and make a much better film, possibly with a convincing main character?Daniel Radcliffe, though, needs changing. I live in hope that he will decide he doesn't suit the role of Harry Potter (s**t a brick!), and hand the part over to a competent, expressive actor so we can watch the film with a straight face. And please, get rid of the cheesy grins.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: Who says sequals are never as good as the original??
Review_body: When I saw "Harry Potter and the Sorceror's Stone", I was very impressed. I thought it was awsome and I saw it numerous times in the theater.  When I went to see "Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets", I was wondering if it was going to be as good.If any of you havn't seen this movie yet and you liked the first one, you won't be dissapointed.  This is just as good, if not better, than the first. Just like the first, it was pretty faithful to the book (it can't be exact because then it would be 4 hours long, which I wouldn't mind).  Infact, it was probably more faithful.  The special effects are awsome and of course, the quidditch (spelling?) is the best part of the movie.  Yes, it is darker and a little scarier than the first (especially if you have archnophobia), but Ron (Rupert Grint) always comes through with the best lines.  And the actor who played professor Lockhart (can't remember the name at the moment) was brilliant.  Nobody could have played him better.To sum it all up, the acting was good (you could tell that the kids had improved from the first movie), the story was good, it was funny and a little scary (the spiders are freaky in this movie), but in the end, this has got to be one of the best movies i've ever seen.  I gotta go see it again.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: I loved Harry Potter and The Sorcerers Stone. I read the book first of course and when I went to see the movie, I did not expect to see so much of the magical things from the book. I was surprised and pleasantly gratified. Well, moving on, I recently went to observe the new Harry Potter movie The Chamber of Secrets. The movie was wonderful! The loyalty Harry Potter had for Professor Dumbledore, it was heart warming. The Spiders seemed very real and the flying car was something I did not expect would be in the movie. Harry was very brave in the battle between him and "Tom Riddle'.  I cannot wait until the next movie, The Prisoner of Azkaban.Thank You,Anitra Rain
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: The good's good, the bad's bad
Review_body: WARNING: Possible spoilers towards the endNot since Blair Witch II has there been a film in which the acting and directing was so sorely lacking. Chris Columbus seems to have a career littered with mediocre movies - Home Alone, Home Alone II, Bicentennial Man. That Bicentennial Man was such a mangled version of Isaac Asimov's novel might suggest that he cannot properly translate books to films;Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone was mostly saved by the talents of seasoned actors such as Robbie Coltrane (the lumbering Hagrid), Richard Griffiths (the detestable uncle Vernon), Richard Harris, Maggie Smith, John Cleese and the outstanding Alan Rickman. The casting for these parts was beyond reproach (except Richard Harris, not the perfect dumbledore in my opinion -- however he delivered a sterling performance anyway).Although the actors and actresses reprised their roles flawlessly (Miriam Margolyes in particular delivered an excellent, though short, performance), this was not enough to redeem this film in light of the dull, monotonous acting by Emma Watson as Hermione (there were points in this film where one could really feel her reaming off the lines from the script, not putting feeling into her performance). Daniel Radcliffe's performance was better, but by no means up to the standard one would expect.When I watched Sorcerer's Stone I wondered about the casting of Rupert Grint as Ron. This film made my mind up. He looks the part, but as soon as he opens his mouth he is wrong. In some of the more "frightening" scenes of the film he was squealing like a suckling pig - these destroyed any atmosphere Columbus had managed to scrape together. There's something about hearing the missing link between a piglet and a human in Dolby 6.1 Surround Sound that distresses me.While on the issue of the sound, I think it was very overdone -- in the Quidditch match, for instance, when the bludger is following harry, the sound of it crashing through things sounded more like a cannon being fired than some wood being broken); in the scenes with the giant spiders (where a silent padding sound would have built more atmosphere) the sound was more like spiders wearing steel clogs walking across glass. Either that or they were chopsticks on legs.While talking about the sound, the (presumably computer generated) fire in the torches on the outside of Hogwarts at the end just didn't feel real -- more like silk being blown in a stream of air.This film, for all its failings, isn't the worst film you could waste your time watching (xXx comes to mind...). If you read the book and had a vivid picture of what things should be like I'd really advise against it, though. If you haven't read the book, the quality of the good acting is really good (although, conversely, the bad acting is REALLY bad), so if you can bear it, you'll be rewarded by the performances of Miriam Margolyes, Alan Rickman and others. Unfortunately, Richard Griffiths (uncle Vernon) just doesn't have enough to work with in order to give as good a performance as he did in the previous film.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: the film was amazing. infact it was even better then the last. I did not like the spiders, but that has alot to do with the fact that the graphics were so good they looked so real.(i dont like spiders) i dont know what else to say except if you have not seen it do it do it NOW.enjoy. :o)
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: Many films fail to measure up to the books on which they are based. The Harry Potter movies are a particularly bitter disappointment for two reasons: the contrast with the book, an unexpected jewel of perfection abundant in cinematographic delights, and the magnitude of the failure given that the project takes 7 years to complete. Short of remaking the first two episodes while the kids are young enough to pass as 11 year-olds, there is only one hope. Teach Daniel Radcliffe to act (which should be possible) and find a director who has taste, style and appreciation for the elegant magic of Joanne Rowling (which is definitely possible). This cinematic event is too important to be able to afford the pathetic flop it's been so far.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: I only watched this film last night, and i found it throughly enjoyable! Definitely a must-see film, and much better than the first. It was a lot funnier, not to mention scarier! As expected, there were a few let downs when some of the funniest or important scenes were left out. However, you have to realize not everything that sounds brilliant in the book can be just as good on the screen. Never-the-less.....i strongly recommend it!!!! Role on The Prisoner Of Azkaban!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: A great film that exceeds the first as it is more of a movie than a straight copy of the book. The younger members of the cast have grown into their rolls and are all more convincing second time around. The special effects are good but the people are still the stars. Quite how they will replace dear departed Richard Harris I don't know as he excels again, but in every other way this augers well for the future films.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: Brilliant cast, good film, change the director please
Review_body: OK... this film is definitely worth seeing.  I don't need to say much about that.  Darker and better than the first.My only complaint, like the last film, is that the extraordinary acting talent of the cast is dragged down by the director's slow pace.  Chris  As a result the amazing acting starts to look a little thin from having to hold their facial expressions for so long.I heard tell that next years film may have a different director.  A great idea , trusting that they keep the cast unchanged.Oh, and would someone PLEASE give Daniel Radcliffe a wig that's not quite so obvious.  He's an utterly brilliant actor - why hide his talent under quite so much hair?Now go see the film and find out if you agree!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: I wasn't a fan of the first movie and actually shuddered at the fact that I had to see "Chamber of Secrets", but I was so pleasantly surprised.  So much better than the first in my opinion. Also, seeing Richard Harris, the one and only, in his final role, obviously laboring through, still performing as only he could.  Well worth it just for that.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: Captures the spirit of the books.  The kids are great, the visual effects are great, it's not too scary for kids and I think the entire audience was in agreement that we wish it could have been longer.  I hope "Prisoner of Azkaban" is way longer, or at least a two-parter!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: this movie was definatly 100 times better than the first, but the 2nd book is also twice as good as the first book, so what do you expect!  but aside from storyline, the actors have matured SO much, it's nuts, the first movie they look so young, you can tell they've aged very much since the beginning of filming of the sorcerers stone.  they also have gotten much better at acting, and playing their respective roles, especially daniel radcliffe and tom felton.  daniel(harry) fulfills his role of victor/defender/hero MUCH better in the 2nd film, he is truly a hero, and did an awesome job. and i just love tom felton, he has truly made draco the little devil he is, but i luv him neway! fans of all ages will surely enjoy this film, it is hilarious, GREAT comic relief, but also SCARY, i jumped a few times, and i'm 19 and i don't get scared easily( not saying this film scared me, but i was started and some things in it are just creepy! ) it's great, i say the target audience, which would enjoy and get the most out of this film is definatly those ages 13-25 who've read the books, and in addition adults of course!  but as for the younger crowd, well i don't think they can appreciate the books, and the myths/legends/facts jk rowling draws everything from, or the symbolism/foreshadowing etc. not to mention this movie is definatly scarier than potter #1   THIS GETS A BIG 10 FROM ME. GO READ THE BOOKS THO!!!!!!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: Young Wizard Potter returns to Hogwarts
Review_body: Much better than the first movie, this 2:40 tome passes without much squirming on the part of the young ones. There are a few scary sequences during which your under-9 children might want to hold onto your arm but overall this movie moves right along with excellent visuals and tight acting. While the movie adheres rather strictly to Rowling, there is enough imaginative license to keep the adults amused while the kids enjoy it as well. Overall, this movie is the equivalent of tiramisu on the second day--much better mixing of ingredients and more subtle flavors. Enjoy.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: I went and saw Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets today.  I was expecting a great movie and my expectations were fulfilled!  This movie is great!  After reading the book, the movie kept to the book and matched what I had imagined! It was very exciting and there was never a dull moment. The effects were better, too!  I noticed a huge improvement  This movie, unlike most sequels, was better than the first!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: This movie to me was the BEST movie ever because I thought that this movie was going to seem sooooo long because it was approx. 2 hours and 45 minutes long!  To my surprise it wasn't long at all because the movie kept me interested at every single second... it's really sad that the person who played Albus Dumbledore died two weeks ago.... otherwise the movie was the best that it could be!  Everything looked so real I'd advise everyone to go see it!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: A extrodinary adventure through a mystical legend, that will entrall you to laugh, and journey into your deepest fears
Review_body: Christoper Columbus' Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, is a far cry from the preceding Harry Potter movie. For this time, a more fearful mystrey awaits the willing youngsters from Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Columbus' witty ideas, the musical score, and the realistic-like visual effects brings true magic to the screen. Also the acting has taken a sharp turn from Sorcere's Stone, the players have grown and taken these films to a more proffesional level.Even John Williams' musical score will keep you in complete suspense as you sit on the edge of your seat. Although the new movie has a more frightening touch it has the audience anxiously waiting to gasp and gaze at the impressive dramatics of the big screen. With a new approach to the special effects, the movie franchise has introduced a greater excitement in scenes such as the Quidditch game, Aragog's lair, and The Chamber of Secrets. Chris Columbus takes a new perspective on the movie, as he draws away from JK Rowling's literary works. Subtle changes have been made in the movie and have finally created a comfortable enviorment for the wizarding world. The new action sequenes may be quite scary to children below the age of seven, but the tasteful violence will enthrall young audiences as for older ones too. The transition from the first to second movie is smooth,not like a choppy pass on such as The Mummy Returns. This masterpiece deserves much praise for the hard work for the cast and crew, yet there are times when there is not enough background information for one to fully understand the Potter history. This movie will take anyone to hights in the Weasley's flying Ford Angila, and take one to the spooky depths of salazar's chamber. Harry Potter fans will leave not disappointed to the least bit, and ordinary muggles will return with a drop of magical blood in them, for they have been to Hogwarts... and back. (A+_crazykoura)
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: This movie is amazing! Lots of action and suspense with just enough humor to keep you waiting on the edge of your seat for more. I cannot wait to see number three, and four, and five, and six, and so on and so forth! I love all of the characters and casting! Way to go cast, crew, and, audience! Loved it!!!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS MOVIE
Review_body: This is the best harry potter movie yet.  it stays true to the book, plus has some wonderfully fun additions.  the special effects are awesome.  this movie is awesome.  kenneth branaugh is amazing.  dobby is adorable.  if you haven't seen this movie go see it now.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: This movie was a thousand times better than the first.  The kids in the cast clearly have matured a lot, and so have their acting skills.  It's got more of a plot, less introducing characters, and didn't get slow at any point in the movie.Daniel Radcliffe and Rupert Grint are starting to hold a special place in my heart, as is Tom Felton, who plays Draco Malfoy.  However, the casting of Kenneth as Gilderoy Lockhart definitely was a disappointment, and not at all how I pictured Lockhart to look.The special effects could've been better, but they were definitely better than that of the first movie.Despite these minor setbacks, this is definitely a must see movie.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: First I would like to say that I felt the "Chamber of Secrets" was so much better than I had expected it to be.  If you haven't seen the movie yet, be warned.  There are going to be some spoilers.I thought the opening was good.  It allowed one to see a little of Harry's life with the pics of his mom and dad, and his friends, Ron and Hermione. It just shows one how much Harry misses his friends at Hogwarts.  Then Dobby warns us about some "great danger."  After about an hour of exploration and detective work, we are taken the the Chamber of Secrets.  Tom Riddle is revealed as the 16 year-old Lord Voldomort, sends a Basilisk to kill Harry, but his bravery defeats his soon to be enemy.  The day is saved, and we once again wait in agony until the "Prisonor of Azkaban" comes out in 2004.Now for my thoughts on the direction of the film.  I felt Daniel, Rupert, and Emma did an absolute terrific job as Harry, Ron, and Hermione.  Kenneth Branagh was the only man I know who could have played Gilderoy Lockhart as I saw him. Jason Isaacs also did a wonderful job playing the always pleasant (wink, wink) Lucious Malfoy. I had watched The Patriot, and thought that he did a really good job playing a bad guy, and when I came to this website to see who else was added to the cast, I saw his name and was delighted with joy.Everything was as I had imagined it from the book.  I was a little dissapointed that we weren't directly introduced to Professor Dippet, and the fact that we never got a chance to know that Ginny Weasley, but that's just me. I really didn't think about those parts of the book until I started thinking back on the book and the film.As I said, it'll be a long, rough two years until we can see the next book in live action, but I think that watching the DVD's and reading the books might keep me occupied until then.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: Excellent if you've read the book.
Review_body: Chamber of Secrets is an excellent movie. However, like the Sorcerer's Stone, it falls into the same assumption that you've read the book. However, this movie will not disappoint fans and Kenneth Branaugh as Gilderoy Lockeheart is hilarious!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: Many have said that sequels hardly ever surpass their originals. Though this is true, it is not the case with Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets.  In my opinion, this one was far better than the first. Don't get me wrong, i loved the first, but this one really was a lot better. What made this one better, i thought, were the special effects. In the first, they were good, but now they're amazing. In other movies where computer animation was used, you can tell that it isn't real.  However, in this movie, everything looks realistic. Anyway I truly recommend this movie to everyone. It really doesn't matter what age you are or if you are a Harry Potter fan. Trust me, it's worth the money!!P.S. Thanks for taking the time to read. Hope you enjoy it as much as I did.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: I watched this movie with my family and we loved it. It's great fun for all ages. It's scarier and funnier than the first. Also the actors themselves have evolved a lot into their characters. I loved it so much more then the first movie, lots more action and lots more mystery. Everything is a hundred times better. I'd say its the "Best movie Ever!" 10/10
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: Even better than the last one! Great!
Review_body: This Harry Potter (I won't bother to explain the plot - you all know it) is simply amazing. It surpasses the first one by several wand-lengths. Daniel 'Harry' Radcliffe is his usual brilliant self, but it's obvious that Emma 'Hermione' Watson and Rupert 'Ron' Grint are more used to being on a filmset now. They are both great, but I'll have to admit that I like Rupert the most. The expression on his face when he meets the spiders! Tom 'Draco' Felton is also great, and so are, of course, all the adult actors in CoS too. This time it's scarier (I was dangerously close to wetting my pants a couple of times), darker and SO much better! The difference between the two books aren't nearly as huge as the difference between the two movies. It totally deserves to be the box office block buster it may (and WILL) become!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: This film was a wonderful followup to the first year.  The characters stayed true to the book.  The effects were well integrated.  Most of the characters were well cast.  The only exception would be the choice for Gilderoy Lockhart.  Not that the Kenneth Branagh wasn't great, he just didn't fit the image I had in my head.  The other fans of the books and the movies made similar comments.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: There was a child sitting next to me frightened, covering his ears in horror for probably half of the movie.  I do not consider Harry Potter a "moderately horrific" film as PG would entail.As I left I heard a father mention to someone else, "now I understand why so-and-so didn't want to see this movie.  It was very scary".Please, consider not seeing this movie at all.  If you must see it, PLEASE PREVIEW IT before allowing any child under 13 to see it.  I cannot stress this enough.My child saw this movie with a family member without my knowledge.  He had nightmares for about two weeks about spiders, and now after seeing it for my self, I am sickened to think what he must have went through seeing it.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: Okay, I am a huge HP fan...of the books. When I went to go see the first movie, i thought it was good, but i didnt like it as much as i thought i would. Now, when i went to go see the 2nd HP movie, you all can imagine that i thought it was going to be the same as the first. Choppy, mixed up and not that great. I prolly wouldnt have gone to see it, but my sister wanted to see it (shes 11) so i HAD to go take her to see it. I was so surprised to see that i liked this one! It had flow, more action, and it was just all around MUCH better than the first one! I even screamed at one point..i forget where...but i just got into this one. Well, that is my opinion.Love ya'll Meagan
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: booooring with a complete lack of magic...
Review_body: I consider myself a good critic of fantasy/children films...Mostly due to my attention span never developing beyond the age of 7 and my hunger for magical things being so alive I kept the stupid window to my room open for Peter Pan at the age of 14...Oh I knew he was not real, but what is the point of rubbing that in...Therefore, me falling asleep during the first Harry Potter film and fighting with sleep during the second one definitely means SOMETHING...I must admit I didn't really expect much in the first place; creating a huge movie from a popular book ON DEMAND can never spell art, but I thought maybe, MAYBE, it could be fun...Not only was I disappointed by the fact that bits and pieces were cut out completely (Ok, I understand the necessity) but why add USELESS parts then that could be found nowhere in the book and add cheapness to the already bad movie?? (Indiana Jones scene of almost falling out of the flying car in the second movie? Artistic freedom? What artist? What art?) Not to mention the fact that if we hadn't read the book we would not care at all about the characters of the film since they are never really developed in the movie...It is hard for us to notice this fact since we do heavily rely on our memory of the book to follow the movie; yet the fact that there is very little connection between the audience and the kids does subconsciously ruin a great deal...Bland conversations, overdone special effects (was Dobby really THAT freaky and unlovable looking?? Since when??? Couldn't we have a touch less computer graphics and a bit more human touch?) and cheap shots at making us laugh...mostly relying on Ron saying things like: "can we go now, I am scared" (insert a stupid and annoying facial expression)...Where did the subtle darker humor go? Basically, it is sad to note that this may be the fantasy children movie of the new generation...No memorable original moments, humor or truly magical scenes (ET, Goonies, Time bandits, Mary Poppins etc)...Basing it all on computer animation, special effects, plot and mooooney...Brainwashed kids will like it, adults will forget what to look for and we can all be convinced that since the media tells us it is grand, then it must be so...A good fantasy movie is not supposed to make us bored, not even for a minute; it is supposed to keep us wanting to see certain scenes again and again, making us remember the movie as something we find special and original, and I just cannot wait to see that scene where Harry is walking and then he stops and says something!!!!! Will the fun never end????????? BLEH.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: Brilliantly Done and Beautiful to Look At
Review_body:
As a huge fan of the books, it's a delight to see how closely both of the movies have followed them. "Chamber of Secrets" was exhilarating and enthralling from beginning to end. In fact, I was so engrossed that I didn't realize until I got out of the film and looked at my watch that it had been close to a three hour movie.As a reader, I develop a picture in my mind of the world of Hogwarts as the author describes them, and "Chamber" managed to live up to my own imagination, which few movies-based-on-books do. The action was fast and well done, not carrying on too long before moving to the next scene, the CGI was believable (although, as much as I loved Dobby in the book, I have to admit that he was a bit annoying in the movie) and those kids are so well casted for their roles it's almost amazing that three so young have truly mastered their characters - Daniel Radcliffe *IS* Harry Potter as I always imagined him to be like.As a twenty something generation-x'er, I enjoyed it just as much as the younger demographics (incidentally, there seemed to be more people my age than children going to see this movie, but that might be attributed to the 9:55 p.m. time slot in which I saw it), and found myself standing and clapping along with the rest of the theater, as well as the characters in the film in the final sequence. Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets truly transcends age to be something everyone can enjoy.
And enjoy it is exactly what I did. Bring on "Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban"! :-)
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: Nice second movie in general... However...
Review_body: The movie was excellent regarding the adventure Harry had during his year of study, but I do find the underlying plot of the books to dropped out of the movie.Small things in the eyes of the movie makers, but these small things build a foundation to the grand plot that is carrying out through the book series.Personally I wish there would be more studying and more of these small details included in the movie versions of the third and following books.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: I thoroughly enjoyed the books and the films
Review_body: I found this film even better than the first. The action was immediate, and the effects superb. I thought the acting was brilliant, and I don't agree that the leading child actors are getting too old for the parts. Surely they should age with the characters portrayed? Overall, a superb film!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: Having read all four of the Harry Potter Books I looked at this upcoming movie a little more critically. Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets did a fantastic job in bring the second year to life.  Chris Columbus the directed has been criticized for his focus on the special effects of the movie rather than the text of the movie overall.  I beg to differ.  Columbus's focus on special effects is one of the important things that brought this movie to life.  Bringing this book to life is no easy task and Chris Columbus has done an excellent job with his intense special effects. Daniel Radcliffe returns to play his famous role yet-Harry Potter. His two sidekicks Hermione Granger (Emma Watson) and Ron Weasley (Rupert Grint) embark on another adventure where they investigate the legend of the Chamber of Secrets.  Let's face it, these kids are Harry, Hermione, and Ron.  They prove time and again how magical these books and movies are.  Draco Malfoy (Tom Felton), Potter's enemy does an excellent job making the viewer hate him and his family.  A final bravo goes to the rest of the cast: Maggie Smith (Professor McGonagall), Robbie Coltrane (Hagrid), Alan Rickman (Professor Snape), Kenneth Branagh (Gilderoy Lockheart).  The faculty and staff of Hogwarts that keep the students in line and on their toes at all times.  Richard Harris who played Albus Dumbledore.  He did an excellent job portraying the lighthearted but strong Dumbledore.  Harris will forever live on in our hearts as the one and only Dumbledore.  Anyone who takes on this role will have their hands full.  He will forever be remembered and missed.For an enthusiastic Harry Potter fan like myself, I am glad to see that the magic continues on in the second year and makes me look forward to Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets is the fast paced sequel in the Harry Potter series.  The young actors have matured in more ways than one, the older actors are still amazing, but what else is to be expected when teaming together Richard Harris (Prof. Dumbledore), Dame Maggie Smith (Prof. McGonagall), Alan Rickman (Prof. Snape) and Robbie Coltrane (Rubeus Hagrid). This movie is slightly darker than the first, but that's to be expected when there are disembodied voices and one gigantic snake.  The film introduced aspects such as new characters with a fluidity that if made like the first movie would have looked choppy and second rate.  This movie is absolutely fantastic and has me counting the days until the release of the third movie which will be the introduction of a new director and many new characters to the world of Harry Potter.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: Yes, it is indeed a very good movie. Both for movies in general and as a Fantazy Saga. But it has something that is missing or feels incomplete. Why didn't I feel as thrilled as when I watched the first movie? I actually felt a little bit disappointed. I think it has some problems. And the most of it has to do with the rythm of the movie. What I really liked with the first movie was rythm in it. The way it was cut and told was in fact - excellent! The way the characters were introduced, the way of telling the story with the camera which sometime really rested on the pictures. If it was a children's movie or not has nothing to do with if it was good or bad. It was indeed a really excellent handicraft. But this movie lacks the balance of the first one. Even if it is long, I actually think the movie would have been better if they made it even longer! Why? - The story and the characters are not introduced properly. The editing is faster then that in the first one and details which could have been exciting or funny gets lost or actually even destroyed because of this. It feels like that they could have done so much more with everything. In this movie I have no feeling for the characters. Not for the new ones nor even the old ones. Only a stupid owl and a Phoenix gets my sympathy. they were indeed the best with this movie!Another problem is the one of all sequels. This movie rely too much on the first one. Old jokes and ingredients have already past the "best before date". Why didn't they concentrate on the original stuff and characters in the second book? Now the result becomes only "so so". This means that if you haven't seen the old one, you can not see this one. You are not properly introduced. And if you see the second first, you also destroy the jokes in the first one. If you have seen the first one, you will feel disappointed on this one.They tried to do an action-sequel. It is still a good movie but it failed in its intentions. Because of the lack of originality and the fact that the team did a better movie before this one, if I had to be the judge, I can only give this movie a 7 out of 10. Sad, yes . . . But you still have to go and see it!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: I have seen this movie 5 times! I saw it that many times because it is the best movie ever! It also has my favorite actor and actress in it (Daniel Radcliffe and Emma Watson)!  I think many people will enjoy this movie! When I went into the theater once I saw adults in there alone! It is funny and a big thriller!My favorite character would have to be Ron because he is very funny! I also think all the other people in the movie and help put it together did a wonderful job!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: Excellent, as good if not better than the 1st!
Review_body: This was a great sequel, good portrayal of the story, great effects, and great  actors.  With the new characters this sequel had a lot to add to the first film, and was a real pleasure to see.    I definitely recommend it- and read the books! It makes it all come to life :)  The 3  kids are fabulous, and the movie was really excellent.  Lots of action, lots of fun, well done.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: Having been a huge fan of the first movie and of the books, I had nothing but high hopes for The Chamber of Secrets.  I must say that this film exceeded every one of my expectations.All of the performances in the film were top notch, especially Rupert Grint, who played Ron.  He was so much better in this film than in The Sorcerer's Stone.  Some great new casting was done.  Kenneth Branagh was perfectly cast as the inept Gilderoy Lockhart, and Jason Isaacs slid perfectly into the role of the slimy Lucius Malfoy.  And even Dobby the House Elf, who was being touted as the next Jar Jar, was very well done.The film is much, much darker than the first in every aspect.  And the final fight between Harry and The Basilisk is a sight to behold.  Speaking of The Basilisk, the special effects in this film went well beyond the effects of the first.  They seemed much more realistic.All in all, this is a simply wonderful film that should be treasured for years and years to come.  I highly recommend this film to anyone looking for a good time.Note: This film, although rated PG, definitely pushes the boundaries(in my opinion, it does) of this rating, and I strongly caution parents who bring their child to see it, it will scare your child.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: It's A LOT better than the first. Rupert,Emma, and Dan seem to be a lot more confident on camera than they were in the First movie. They've grown into their roles. The movie was also a lot funnier, which made it a better movie.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: This Movie was probably the best movie I have ever seen. It has Action, comedy, Drama, and adventure! It helps kids follow their Dreams, my little girl now looks up to Everything Harry Potter would do. She now reads the books all the time! It really encourages kids! Everyone should go see it! Its a great family movie, now, me and my kids go see it again and again!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: Great sequel, wonderful direction, good screen adaptation.
Review_body:
It's difficult to watch a movie after reading the book without prejudice or bias, so with great trepidation and anticipation I took my family to see the second Harry Potter movie. I loved it! I know it's difficult to include everything in a movie and although I missed a lot of things in the movie, like the denogming and Percy's girlfriend sub-plot, their lack of appearance in the movie didn't take away from the movie plot at all.The attention to detail made it evident that this was Columbus' favorite book and it made for a better movie. The grounds of Hogwarts were just as I pictured them to be. The casting of Lockhart could not have been better!
I can't wait for the DVD! This is a definite must-buy for any Harry Potter fan and Muggle as well!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: The same successful formula used in the first Harry Potter film is repeated once more in this one. The story drags on quite a bit, but I guess the children like the small off-topic spin-offs in the movie. Overall I liked the film, but at least an hour could easily be cut out to make it better.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body:
I saw HP 1 first, and thought, "Ok, pacing isn't that good, but it's beautifully shot and the music is very good, fitting, etc." Then I went back and read the books and thought they were enthralling. HP is truly a work of art. Then I went back to HP 1 on video and thought, "Ok I see where this comes from. It's really quite nice, now that I know what it refers to."
I approached COS the same way. There was a lot of ink written about how CC had accepted his limitations and was working within them comfortably on COS, so the movie seemed like a more comfortable, smoother film. I'm sad to say that, while the film is definitely more limited, it's not at all comfortable.The pacing was just horrible, with absolutely no dramatic tension. There was a superfluous car chase scene, which I guess was supposed to add action, while the "action" sequence with the whomping willow was ponderously slow. To top it off, Snape's scene was cut in favor of a sequence obviously culled from HP 1's cutting room floor. The enchanted bludger was quite fun. But then we go back to our stupor, until the final sequence with the slythering monster, which is even more unfrightening than dobby.  All in all, this was a severe disappointment.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: RATING: 10 out of 10Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets is the best fantasy movie to date. Suspenseful, funny, and intriguing, Chamber of Secrets is twice as good as the Sorcerer's Stone. All roles are played expertly - exactly as you would picture them if you've read the story, which is just as good. Chris Columbus was the perfect choice of directors for this movie, being as how faithful the movie is to its written version. Steven Kloves stayed very true to the story-line, along with help from J.K. Rowling herself.The actors and actresses of this movie have improved greatly in their acting skills, specificly Daniel Radcliffe, Rupert Grint, and Emma Watson, who have come a long way since Sorcerer's Stone. The special effects of Chamber of Secrets are superb, especially in the final showdown against the Basilisk and in the Gryffindor/Slytherin Quidditch match. For any Potter fan, it's a must have.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: This movie continues the excellent standard set in the first movie. The special effects are outstanding and the characters continue to be exciting and interesting.  The young actors continue their great performance bringing each character to life with riviting performances. Each has their own special quality that makes their character portrayal their own.  It is an all-around outstanding movie with great special effects, beautiful scenery, and wonderful storyline. I look forward to the next one.  Have watched this one about fifteen times.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: it is the BEST!! l LUV it!!!
Review_body: hi, im such a big, i mean BIG, fan of harry potter!!! harry potter and the chamber of secrets is the best movie of the year ( or more, if it was out earlyer ). i cant wait 't'll the 3rd movie, it is very exciting, even if i only read the book. i cant wait one more year!!!
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: a MUST SEE MOVIE for everyone!
Review_body: computer animation lovers will definitely fall in love with this movie as the animation is some of the best ever (minus Lord of the Rings movies). HP lovers are in for a treat as this movie brings to life the characters in the best way (perfect guy for Lockhart, he really seemed conceited). better than the first film and and a much better understanding of wizards and the life at Hogwarts. like i said, a MUST SEE MOVIE for everyone.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: I have read the book as well as seen the movie and i think both are very good in there own right.... The book as more to it and gives you more information...while the film on the other hand gives all the information in a smaller space of time and doesn't explain every detail from the first movie as well as explaining it further if that make sense... Daniel is brilliant as ever playing Harry. and hopefully will carry on to do so in the rest of the films....his chemistry/friendship with Rupert and Emma is shown on screen and off. I cant wait for film 3 and 4 to come out...i have read the books and would like to see the out come of the film...what bits are missing and also if they have added anything which makes the film more funny/different to the books....i have to admit that when harry potter 1st came out in 2001 i wasn't bothered about it..but someone advised me to read the 1st book which i got as a present because they told me that i would enjoy both the book and the film and i haven't looked back since now i just cant wait for the next..... i give the film and the book 10/10
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: The SFX were impressive, especially the character of Dobby. He was well great. I couldn't tell he was CG by his bad creation, but through the fact there was no way they could have done it otherwise. In fact the CG character of Dobby is very similar looking to Gollum in Lord of The Rings and the CG Asgard in television series Stargate SG-1 (speaking of textures) which which speaks well for Stargate SG-1 if it can do just as good as a top movie like this...and top it is. The CG Spiders were incredibly creepy and realistic looking. Not being too scared of Spiders, they kind of made me jump. I felt by body tense up as the gave case to Harry and Ron, which is a good thing because not often do I find myself doing this in movies. The person I had sat beside seemed pretty scared of the spiders as well.John Williams score was very much like his original score with old themes returning and some of the music sounding like music from his Indiana Jones scores. I found myself whistling the main theme of Harry Potter for most of the night and on occasion not realizing I was doing it until someone else pointed it out to me.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: The Harry Potter films keep getting better film by film
Review_body: There is a rule which say that a sequel is always going to be worse than the first film. But with Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets and Lord of The Rings: The Two Towers it is shown that a sequel can be equally good or even better than the first film.As long as you have got a good story ,something that J.K Rowling certainly has delivered. Then the film makers is going to be able to do a even better job with the experiences they got from the first filmWhile i liked Harry Potter and The Sorcerers Stone it had the problem of having to introduce the characters and the wizarding world (fx. Quidditch or the maildelivering owls).Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets perfectly draws out the important things from the book and mix it up with some of the funny moments that make J.K Rowling's books a joy to read (I'm a big fan of the books if you haven't noticed).The difference between the two films is that the important thing in the first is the introduction of Harry Potter and his surroundings and then the story is just something that you put in between. In the second film the story is the thing which is focused one and you are still able to get some new informations about the characters, and at the same time introduce some new. You also got better actors, because the kids have matured and got some experience. When you combine the better structured story, the more experienced actors and the experiences that the crew have got from the first film, you get a very very good film which captures the essence of the books.All in all "The Harry Potter films keep getting better film by film" and if you have only just seen Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets you can look forward to Harry Potter and The Prisoner of Azkaban
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: A typical Harry Potter film, with stunning performances from: Danial Radclif as Harry Potter, Rupert Gritt as Ron Weasely, and the perfectly G-O-R-G-E-O-U-0-S-E , Emma Watson as Hermione Granger(her parents are the G-R-E-A-T-E-S-T artists E-V-E-R!!!!!!!!). And of course I cant forget to mention the marvelouse Richard Harris as Hogwarts Head Marster, Albus Dumbledor, and it was an extreme tragedy when Richard Harris died a little while after the release of 'Chamber of Seacrets' on to DVD and VHS. i think it is safe to say that Richard Harris made the character Albus Dumbledor what he is today. As a fan i can say honestly that, like other fans i await the release of the rest of the Harry Potter books on to the big screen, however I don't know how thay will replace the awesome talent of Richard Harris, but they will shurly be great films none the less. Thank you for reading my review on the movie 'Harry Potter and the Chamber of Seacrets'Peter Scott Wilsonp.s. if Emma Watson is reading this, I think you are the most B-E-U-T-I-F-U-L girl that E-V-E-R lived.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: Darker than Philosopher's/Sorcerer's Stone, and an improved performance from Daniel Radcliffe
Review_body: Chamber of Secrets is a bit darker than Philosopher's Stone (UK)/Sorcerer's Stone (US), and Daniel Radcliffe's acting had improved this time round (he was a little wooden in the first film).Dobby the House-Elf is brilliant, not just in being a CG creation, but his character is just plain hilarious. And thee addition of Lucius Malfoy, Draco's father and Dobby's master, adds to Chamber's darker edge - he is a sinister rich guy who carries an air of menace about him.Chamber has a couple of noticeable mistakes (in the Quidditch scene, when Draco falls off his broom, and when the Bludger crashes into Oliver Wood); but it's a film that Harry Potter enthusiasts will enjoy.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: The one main reason why I like this movie is : It is exciting, and keeps me nervous all the time. During the part in which Harry fights with Riddle, at first Harry is beaten by the curse & I really think that Harry would die. However, with the help of the Phoneix which is sent by Dumbledore, Harry finally can escape from the attack and be safe. In addition, the music, the vivid acting of characters, it all makes me thrill and as if I were in the scene, witnessing the whole incident. I think the music is well written and digital sound effect in the theatre is astonishing. I can still hear all the sound effects even when I am sleeping. Besides, the story fulfills the spirit and the ideal of youngsters: fight against the enemy and having mysterious adventure. I learnt that we have to be brave when we are in tough situation. Furthermore, we need to have confidence for ourselves and at last the good guy can beat the evil. Though we can see such plot and philosophy in other movies, but I am truly touched in this particular one. The story seems to be a mystery when people become petrified one by one. However, with Harry at the most important role, he solves the mystery by himself and fights against Lord Voldemort. Finally he wins and there comes a happy ending. I think throughout the whole movie, the acting of characters, the music, the set-up and the storyline all reach a satisfactory standard for audience.I strongly recommend that all students should watch this movie as it is one of the greatest movies one should not miss. After watching it, I come out with a view that life is full of hope. The only thing is you have to be determinant and at last you will win.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: Harry Potter is visited by a curious creature named Dobby Dobby tells potter to not go back to school Harry says he id still going the platform doesn't work for potter Potter and Ron took the Enchanted car The car is broken Harry and Ron almost get expelled Ron gets a letter from his mom Ginny likes Harry This movie is great! Potter enjoys school so far. Until Malfoy try's to strait up murder him. Granger is then putrefied. Hag rid is accused of murder. Tom riddle hides his snake inside his Ginormous secret chamber. harry blows up aunt marge. Demeanors come and take charged. His godfather is his only family member to still be alive. He then dies in a later film. Harry then has no more family members left
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: Ugh. I can't begin to describe how much this movie is horrible. I feel like punching that Radcliff bastard in the face, he's the main reason this movie sucked so bad. The acting in this movie was horrible, completely and must utterly horrible. Especially because of Daniel Radcliff.Chris Columbus turned an amazing book into a third grade children's movie. I can't believe this movie got a 7.3 rating. And what truly shocked me was that the third movie only got a 7.8. I'd give this movie a negative rating if I could compared to the The Prisoner of Azkaban. Alfonso Cuarón did a great job on it, made it a much darker movie, a much more of a serious movie. He managed to turn it from a kids movie, from something you'd expect the Olsen Twins or Lindsy Lohan to pop up any second to a real quality film. Maybe not an excellent movie, still, something you could enjoy watching. While watching the first and second movies I felt like I was about to vomit any minute, and the look on my face was as if I just turned on my TV only to that all my channels turned into VH1 Classic on a permanent 70's clip show, or MCM on a never-ending french clip run (AKA - MCM at any given time.) In conclusion, everything about this movie was horrible except the basic storyline. Someone destroy these movies so people would read the books instead.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review title: I give the film 2 thumbs up.
Review_body: If you thought the first movie was good than you will think this one is great. This is a great family movie. Both adults and children can follow this move with ease. This movie is not just another child's cartoon with unbelievable monsters like "Monsters Inc."; it is well-developed movie with great special effects. I personal have not read the book, but now after seeing this movie, it makes me want to read the whole series starting with the first one. My favorite character in this film was Dobby the mischief elf; he is mysteriously great in this film. It was apparent to me that Harry Potters (played by Daniel Radcliffe), Ron Weasley (played by Rupert Grint), and Hermione Granger (played by Emma Watson) has settled comfortably into their roles.The theme I have noticed in this film is that family is not only blood. It is apparent to me that Harry is happier with his Witchcraft family than his summer family. He feels more comfortable at the Hogwarts School.Dobby has come to the home of Harry's new summer home, to warn him of the great danger at the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Harry discovers his ability to speak to snakes as him and his friends enter the second year of Hogwarts. The chamber of secrets has been opened, and it takes the courage of Harry, Ron, and Hermione to use their magical abilities to save themselves and the Hogwarts.I was really impressed with this film and recommend every one to watch it. I give the film 2 thumbs up.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Review_body: This movie could not have been any worse. Intellectually unfit for the smallest child. Propagating themes of mindless rivalry amongst youth as well as racial inequality and awareness. The film is rife with non sequiturs (read: nonsense) and the comedy was really half-hearted. Entertainment has reached yet another low with widespread appreciation of this film.Steve Kloves (Credited with screenplay) and Chris Columbus (Director) obviously aren't losing sleep over targeting young minds with cheap thrills to instill the same type of mentality that has allowed cinema to sink these depths in the first place.
Movie_name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
